solution_line_template: If she drives {miles_today} miles today, the car will have consumed {gallons_per_mile}*{miles_today} = <<{miles_today}*{gallons_per_mile}={gallons_consumed_today}>>{gallons_consumed_today} gallons of gas.

Tomorrow, if she drives {more_miles_tomorrow} more miles, the total distance will be {more_miles_tomorrow}+{miles_today} = <<{more_miles_tomorrow}+{miles_today}={miles_tomorrow}>>{miles_tomorrow} miles.
The fuel consumption by the car tomorrow is {gallons_per_mile}*{miles_tomorrow} = <<{gallons_per_mile}*{miles_tomorrow}={gallons_consumed_tomorrow}>>{gallons_consumed_tomorrow} gallons.

The car's total fuel consumption in the two days is {gallons_consumed_tomorrow}+{gallons_consumed_today} = <<{gallons_consumed_tomorrow}+{gallons_consumed_today}={total_gallons_consumed}>>{total_gallons_consumed} gallons.
